Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.api.index

Class IndexPopulationJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.api.index.IndexPopulationJob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    public class IndexPopulationJob
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A background job for initially populating one or more index over existing data in the database. Use provided store view to scan store. Participating IndexPopulator are added with addPopulator(IndexPopulator, IndexDescriptor, String, FlippableIndexProxy, FailedIndexProxyFactory) before running this job.

      • IndexPopulationJob

        public IndexPopulationJob​(MultipleIndexPopulator multiPopulator,
                          IndexingService.Monitor monitor,

    • Method Detail

      • addPopulator

        MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation addPopulator​(IndexPopulator populator,
                                                    IndexDescriptor indexDescriptor,
                                                    String indexUserDescription,
                                                    FlippableIndexProxy flipper,
                                                    FailedIndexProxyFactory failedIndexProxyFactory)
        Adds an IndexPopulator to be populated in this store scan. All participating populators must be added before calling run().
        Parameters:
        populator - IndexPopulator to participate.
        indexDescriptor - IndexDescriptor meta information about index.
        indexUserDescription - user description of this index.
        flipper - FlippableIndexProxy to call after a successful population.
        failedIndexProxyFactory - FailedIndexProxyFactory to use after an unsuccessful population.

      • run

        public void run()
        Scans the store using store view and populates all participating IndexPopulator with data relevant to each index. The scan continues as long as there's at least one non-failed populator.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • indexAllEntities

        private void indexAllEntities​(PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
                       throws IndexPopulationFailedKernelException
        Throws:
        IndexPopulationFailedKernelException

      • getPopulationProgress

        PopulationProgress getPopulationProgress​(MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation indexPopulation)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Signal to stop index population. All populating indexes will remain in populating state to be rebuilt on next db start up. Asynchronous call, need to await completion.

      • stop

        void stop​(MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation population,
          PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Stop population of specific index. Index will remain in populating state to be rebuilt on next db start up.
        Parameters:
        population - MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation to be stopped.

      • dropPopulation

        void dropPopulation​(MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation population)
        Stop population of specific index and drop it.
        Parameters:
        population - MultipleIndexPopulator.IndexPopulation to be dropped.

      • update

        public void update​(IndexEntryUpdate<?> update)
        A transaction happened that produced the given updates. Let this job incorporate its data, feeding it to the IndexPopulator.
        Parameters:
        update - IndexEntryUpdate to queue.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • awaitCompletion

        public boolean awaitCompletion​(long time,
                               TimeUnit unit)
                        throws InterruptedException
        Awaits completion of this population job, but waits maximum the given time.
        Parameters:
        time - time to wait at the most for completion. A value of 0 means indefinite wait.
        unit - unit of the time.
        Returns:
        true if the job is still running when leaving this method, otherwise false meaning that the job is completed.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the wait got interrupted.

      • setHandle

        public void setHandle​(JobHandle handle)
        Assign the job-handle that was created when this index population job was scheduled. This makes it possible to cancel the scheduled index population, making it never start, through stop().

      • bufferFactory

        public ByteBufferFactory bufferFactory()

      • getMemoryTracker
